attributes.action: Change the law to stop insurance companies discrimating against people with HIV
attributes.background: Currently people living with HIV, who are healthy and who's health is not at risk can pay astronomically more than those who are not living with the condition when taking out travel insurance. This is compunded by people with the condition being completely discounted from certain insurance cover.

attributes.action: Apply the triple lock to existing old age pensions up to the new annual rate.
attributes.background: The post April 6th 2016 pensions will be increased by 2.5% (min. per year) of the full amount starting with £155-65. Pensions being paid prior to April 6th 2016 will only be increased by 2.5% based on the basic of £119-30, not on any extras earned by older pensioners by SERPS, NI contributions etc.
attributes.additional_details: The idea of the petition is to make rises fairer for older pensioners after the start of the NEW FLAT RATE OLD AGE PENSION April 6th 2016. The way the government triple lock pension increases will be applied to pensioners entitled to draw old age pension prior to April 6th 2016 could cause them to lose out very considerably, relative to the new flat rate pensioners, in some economic circumstances. Example when the CONSUMER PRICE INDEX is static or falls as in the figure used in the 2016 rise.

attributes.action: We want a referendum to be held on English membership of the United kingdom.
attributes.background: England would be stronger outside the United Kingdom for the simple reason that Scotland, Wales and Northern island  contribute far less to the Union than they take out. As a result of this England would be stronger outside the UK.

attributes.action: Reverse the decision to charge 3% tax on second homes   (retain for buy to let)
attributes.background: The Government introduced a 3% tax on purchases of second homes (over £40k) on 01/04/16. This was following a consultation on applying a 3% tax on buy to let properties. They did this to close a loop hole.  However, they haven't considered the consequences, or included it in any direct consultation.
attributes.additional_details:
This impacts you if you have your own home and purchase another property. This could be to help your parents, your children, your siblings, your friends. It has nothing to do with buy to let.

My sister looked after my parents as a single mum for 15 years, but they have both passed. She needs help to buy a home the Government can't provide. I will have to pay 3% tax on that home I can't afford.

Many more people will be impacted.  Please sign this petition.  It will impact you unfairly one day.

attributes.action: Name under age murderers or serious offenders and sentence them as adults
attributes.background: Regardless of age, if you are capable of and willing to take or seriously damage/alter another's life, you should be considered old enough to be named, and charged as an adult. A child does not make these decisions, we have to stop protecting them and show them they can't just get away with it again

attributes.action: Stop Crossrail 2 from destroying Iconic buildings in Wimbledon town.
attributes.background: This will effect so many peoples lives during the construction phase over the next 8-10 years, as buildings, homes and companies are demolished leaving business owners scrambling for new jobs. Wimbledon would also be clogged up with traffic jams. This,ultimately will effect the future of Wimbledon.
attributes.additional_details:
At first I was excited about Crossrail 2, until the government revealed the building being demolished. 

The following are the names of companies/buildings that will be demolished:
Center Court
Waitrose
WHsmith
Tesco
M&S
H&M

Coral1,2

Everyday church

attributes.action: Reduce the drink drive limit in England and Wales to the same level as Scotland
attributes.background: In 2014 an estimated 240 people were killed in Great Britain in accidents where at least one driver was over the legal limit. Drinking and driving increases the risk of a crash and the likelihood that death or serious injury will occur. Reducing the limit will save lives and make our roads safer.
attributes.additional_details: In December 2014 the Scottish Executive introduced The Road Traffic Act 1988 (Prescribed Limit) (Scotland) Regulations 2014 which reduced the legal alcohol limit for drivers to 50 milligrams of alcohol in every 100 millilitres of blood. The limit in England and Wales is 80 milligrams of alcohol per 100 millilitres of blood. Bringing the limit in England and Wales in line with the limit in Scotland would be very beneficial as it would reduce accidents, preventing serious injury and death.

attributes.action: Make single parents and sole carers a protected category in legislation.
attributes.background: Single parents and sole carers face barriers to employment and social participation beyond those of parents and carers in general. In addition, caring responsibilities are not a recognised 'category' in legislation that protects individuals in vulnerable groups from discrimination and hate crimes.
attributes.additional_details:
Protected category status would prevent exclusion from services and employment by providing a legal right to access, which could be used, to ensure employers and service providers put in place extra adaptations for lone-caring responsibilities, which are a greater barrier than simply parenthood or caring with wider support. This would also enable legal redress against hate-speech often directed at lone parents.

http://tinyurl.com/zh6kkoz
https://gingerbread.org.uk/content/658/Employment

attributes.action: To create an intermediate tier paper for maths GCSE (all exam boards)
attributes.background: Many students taking the higher tier maths GCSE paper, struggle with the contents, but find the foundation tier too easy. I am petitioning for an 'inbetween paper' that allows students of 'medium ability' to be able to get higher than a grade C at GCSE.

attributes.action: The Government should send a declaration of Secession to the EU immediately
attributes.background: Britain does not need a Trade Deal with the EU, in fact, it will be detrimental.  Art. 50 will lead us into years of negotiation with little to show for it on their terms.  A trade deal will keep also keep us tied to the EU.  We need to declare WTO rules and offset tariffs with savings.
attributes.additional_details: The EU will continue to argue for a Brexit on their terms when it should be on ours.  The UK voted to completely leave the EU and by following Art. 50, we shall be tied to them for years.  A simple declaration of secession will leave the EU with the option of treating the UK as any other 3rd State instead of trying to hang on to us.  Savings will offset any tariffs they choose to impose, or they can choose to work with us tariff free to mutual benefit and we can trade with the World immediately

attributes.action: Request aid from United Nations World Food Programme in reducing malnutrition
attributes.background: Documented cases of child malnutrition are increasing in deprived areas in the UK. Local authorities do not have the resources to cope, and central government funding strategies are exacerbating the situation. Outside help appears to be the only available option.

attributes.action: Make swimming lessons avaliable in all schools
attributes.background: My daughter recently started school I was shocked to find that the school has no Intention to add swimming lessons to its classes surely it's in childrens best interests to ensure they can swim after all how many children drown due to the fact they can't swim
attributes.additional_details: About one in five people who die from drowning are children 14 and. Under

attributes.action: Make it illegal for schools to force pupils to sing religious songs
attributes.background: It is still legal to let a school punish students (through detentions ect...) for not singing religious songs when the songs doesn't apply to their religion or they're not religious at all... this outdated law should be removed
attributes.additional_details: The law states that religious and non religious schools must take part in some form of collective worship and that it must only be of christian character which isn't reflective of the demographic

attributes.action: Ban all non prescription flea treatment for pets in the UK
attributes.background: With 13 million UK households owning a pet, it's common for people to rely on cheap flea treatment. Some non prescription flea treatments do NOT work effectively and will not kill fleas. Studies find that they may, however, kill your pets.
attributes.additional_details:
Not only do these treatments not work but they may actually be dangerous. 

A simple Google search reveals that hundreds of dogs and cats have fallen victim to the ingredients used in cheaper treatments and hundreds have actually died. 

Whilst it's understandably difficult to afford proper flea treatment, this is the price of having a pet and as their owners, we are fully responsible.

Please sign to make any non prescription flea treatment illegal.

attributes.action: Change to Western European time to take advantage of 1hr extra evening daylight
attributes.background: Conversion to Western European time would give one hour additional evening daylight throughout the year. Western France, much of Spain and all of Portugal are to the west of the UK and yet they are 1hr ahead. It would also have a business advantage of harmonising UK time with Western Europe.

attributes.action: Create a virtual parliamentary constituency for serving armed forces personnel.
attributes.background: The choice of voting for the constituency a Serving Member (and his/her family) find themselves in (when based in the UK) or voting for a constituency they had lived in previously is often unsatisfactory.  In my experience serving members don't vote at all and few use their MP.
attributes.additional_details: The creation of a virtual constituency will give serving members of the Armed Forces and their families the opportunity to vote for a person who will directly represent them in Parliament, regardless of where they are based. Critically it will allow the incumbent MP, regardless of party, to immerse him/herself in the specific needs of serving personnel and their families. This role is to be independent of the MoD and the Minister of State for the Armed Forces which reflect Government needs.

attributes.action: DLA low rate mobility and standard rate pip mobility entitled to a free car
attributes.background: Everybody on mobility part PIP/DLA low rate should be entitled to a free car

attributes.action: Honour  Paralympians & Olympians by declaring an extra bank holiday in 2016
attributes.background: As a comparatively small island together we have come second in the Medals table for the 2016 Olympics, and are currently second in the Paralympics medal table. This is a quite remarkable achievement.
attributes.additional_details: Lets make it happen, and demonstrate that we are proud of their achievements and know how to celebrate.

attributes.action: Put a limit on when HGV's and Tractors can access Main Roads and Motorways
attributes.background: During "rush hour" periods 0700-0900 and 1700-1900, HGV's and Tractors should not be allowed on Main Roads or Motorways due to the fact that they make every journey longer.
attributes.additional_details:
A large number of collisions and spillages on roads especially Motorways involve a HGV during busy periods, This leads to severe delays and road closures impacting the remaining 99% of road travellers time at home. 
By limiting the times to which they can travel the rush hour periods should run more smoothly allowing traffic to flow with less accidents

attributes.action: Enable Police and Telephone services to trace and prosecute cold callers.
attributes.background: Cold calling is supposed to be illegal, TPS is not a deterrent, so the Police, trading Standards and Telephone service providers should be compelled to cooperate to trace, arrest, and prosecute offenders. A help line should be created for reporting offending numbers.
attributes.additional_details: In this digital world, it should be possible to trace who purchased any number. Citizens can bar withheld numbers to prevent some calls, but there is a problem with normal numbers. These must be held on record by service providers. They must be traceable to a specific location.

attributes.action: Provide statistical report of areas / numbers of culled badgers hosting TB.
attributes.background: The Government failed to test culled badgers to measure the percentage hosting tuberculosis & the most affected areas.  This data is key. UK Government ignored advice of Wildlife Experts by continuing the Badger cull. Other wildlife such as Deer host TB, so the badger cull policy is flawed.
attributes.additional_details: Despite all efforts by wildlife experts to stop the badger cull the Government continues with a badly devised scheme to reduce TB.  The most important data was never obtained. Recording the number of affected culled badgers and the areas where TB was most prevalent is surely crucial for developing a strategy to reduce Bovine TB.  A statistical report will show where number of TB hosts are more severe.  Joined up interventions such as vaccinations and bio-security on farms are needed.

attributes.action: Make premium rate text services need physical signature on terms and charges.
attributes.background: Premium rate text services send you a text message on your mobile and when you reply/text stop, you get charged without knowing charges or terms and conditions of service. Mobile operators charge on their behalf and you can't contact these premium rate text providers.
attributes.additional_details: It's happening all too often and to vulnerable people. Make it must for premium rate text services providers to get physical signature of billpayers on charges , terms and conditions for these services.

attributes.action: Introduce Mobile phone jammers into prisons to stop prisoners taunting victims
attributes.background: There has been an increase in prisoners taunting victims, intimidating witnesses and accessing social media. Introducing mobile phone jammers into prisons would rectify this with the flick of a button.
attributes.additional_details: The Secretary of state for justice needs to introduce Mobile phone jammers which would stop all prisoners accessing the internet via smart phones and making calls.

attributes.action: Charge those who misuse public services through drink or drug abuse.
attributes.background: Charge those who misuse public services, such as the ambulance service, police, fire service or the NHS, through drink or drug abuse. Use the money raised through these charges to improve those services, funding things like cancer research, police on the streets, keep hospitals open.
attributes.additional_details:
An article from The Telegraph in 2015 in reference to the government looking into the cost of obesity, drug abuse and alcoholism to the UK economy.

http://www.telegraph.co.uk/news/health/news/11769531/Cost-of-obesity-drug-abuse-and-alcoholism-to-be-revealed.html

attributes.action: Change the location of the layby on the A38 southbound near Ripley
attributes.background: As there have been a couple of accidents here and recently the loss of a motorcyclist vs a HGV earlier this week. The layby is so close to the sliproad that people mistake it for one. Which needs to be changed before this happens again. The last one was a fatality. Let's leave it at that!

attributes.action: Discuss the need for a national register for non-participatory fathers.
attributes.background: I feel this register is much needed and highly overdue. Fathers who have children and then, (when it doesn't work with their co-creators) decide to penalise their own children by not regularly visiting, contributing or communicating. This Leaves the mother to counsell their young 'damaged' kids..
attributes.additional_details: I posted an enquiry if a register like this existed, and found one did but only for Domestic Violence (Clare's Law). However, this doesn't help those mothers (generally) who deal with their co-creators choice to not participate. A register is needed because it's a highly common issue, often seeing the same (mostly) men 're-offend' and go on to ruin even more young minds of growing children. This perpetual cycle often repeated could easily be stopped with a register. Divorce is common, so is this

attributes.action: Limit maximum private parking charges.
attributes.background: This petition is to get a law in place to limit the maximum fine private parking companies can charge to £60 and a minimum of a 50% discount if paid within 14 days.

attributes.action: Lift the official secrets act 1989
attributes.background: To the house of commons, The petition of U.K Taxpayers declares that the Westminister child sex abuse enquiry is being prevented by the official secrets act 1989. The petitioners therefore urge the house of commons to lift the official secrets act 1989. And the petitioners remain.
attributes.additional_details: https://lawrenceserewicz.wordpress.com/2015/04/13/official-secrets-act-and-child-sexual-abuse-inquiry-arcana-imperii-and-the-secrets-of-state/

attributes.action: "Superfast" (Fibre) broadband should be made available to Exchange Only lines
attributes.background: During the current "superfast" broadband rollout, many properties are being excluded because they are not connected to roadside cabinets. When these properties were originally connected to their local telephone exchange, cabinets were not in standard use.
attributes.additional_details:
Current regulations say that the new "superfast" technology must be installed outside exchanges in cabinets. Therefore new cabinets should be installed outside existing exchanges (to comply with current regulations) or the regulations should be changed.

Currently the public money being spent on these projects is done so without public consultation. Homeowners and businesses cannot interact with the organisers implementing the projects to ensure fair distribution.

attributes.action: Require all planes to have a central locking system on their overhead lockers.
attributes.background: Following the incidents in Dubai  and Las Vegas it is clear that passengers cannot be trusted to act responsible during an emergency event on an aeroplane. To mitigate this and protect other passengers overhead lockers should be centrally locked by the pilot during take off and landing.
attributes.additional_details: http://www.bbc.co.uk/news/magazine-36985862

attributes.action: Make gift vouchers fair and stop companies keeping your money after expiry.
attributes.background: From refusal to issue change or a credit note when only part of a voucher is used to simply keeping your money if the voucher expires, these practices are unfair and should be stopped. I call for legislation to control the sale and terms of gift vouchers so that money is never allowed to disappear.
attributes.additional_details:
While class action lawsuits have been setting precedence in the US, the UK is still behind. 

A survey in September 2010 by Groupola.com suggested that Britons are have nearly £580m of unused gift vouchers. Many of these won't be honored by issuers.

https://www.theguardian.com/money/2006/apr/29/consumernews.moneysupplement

http://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/news/chill-factore-gift-vouchers-trafford-8532757

https://www.theguardian.com/money/2011/jan/30/are-gift-card-waste-money

attributes.action: Criminalise deliberately or negligently misinforming a planning panel/committee.
attributes.background: It seems wrong to me that such an activity is not already criminal.
attributes.additional_details:
I asked a planning panel committee manager: 

'Am I right in thinking that anyone who intentionally or recklessly misinforms the panel is subject to criminal proceedings?'

and received the reply:
'No, if such a thing was to occur it would not amount to a criminal offence.'

This does not seem right to me.

attributes.action: Stop South Africans voting in UK when Brits can't vote in SA.
attributes.background:
A Brit living in South Africa with permanent residency is prevented from voting in South African elections. However, South Africans can move to the UK and after meeting the residency requirements can vote in all UK elections.
This is grossly unjust and needs to be stopped
attributes.additional_details:
Qualifying Commonwealth citizens can vote in all UK elections once they've been resident for the requisite period but in some Commonwealth countries like South Africa there is no reciprocal agreement. This is blatantly unfair and unjust and must be stopped.

Who can vote in a South African election?
http://www.elections.org.za/content/For-Voters/FAQ--Voter-registration/

Who can vote in a UK election?
http://www.electoralcommission.org.uk/faq/voting-and-registration/who-is-eligible-to-vote-at-a-uk-general-election

Qualifying Commonwealth citizens: http://www.electoralcommission.org.uk/__data/assets/electoral_commission_pdf_file/0009/79515/List-of-eligible-countries.pdf

attributes.action: Compel households to display a sign warning that there is a dog on the premises
attributes.background: Many people may call on a household on a daily basis for legitimate reasons and dog attacks are a significant hazard.  While the number of attacks has fallen after the change in legislation and greater understanding through dog awareness campaigns, it still remains unacceptably high.
attributes.additional_details:
As an example, 2660 postmen/women were attacked by dogs in the last year some leading to a permanent disabling injury. As a postwoman myself I have had a dog bite, which fortunately wasn't serious, but have seen many colleagues that were not so lucky.

A simple sign at the entrance to a property and by the letterbox could help significantly. By making anyone calling at a house aware of the presence of a dog, they can take precautions to ensure their own safety and that of the dog living too.

attributes.action: Overhaul the UK 'honours' system so winners are decided by public vote
attributes.background: The recent 'resignation honours' from David Cameron highlights the massively undemocratic way in which honours are handed out - essentially to his friends and those of his wife. The system of 'honours' should be reviewed and overhauled so it operates in a fully democratic way, with a public vote.

attributes.action: Free First Aid courses
attributes.background: First Aid courses should be available for free as it is a life skill which all of the public should know. This will encourage the public to be good citizens and respect their society.

attributes.action: Legislate to give MPs the sole right to elect party leaders
attributes.background: Current Conservative and Labour Party rules leave the final choice of party leaders exclusively in the hands of party members. This is neither fair nor democratic. Party members do not represent the full spectrum of the electorate supporting their party at the polls, unlike elected MPs.
attributes.additional_details:
This risks the selection of leaders at the polar ends of their respective parties because party members do not represent the middle ground occupied by most voters. The recent leadership tribulations of both main parties illustrate this only too well. 
Legislation should be introduced in support of representational democracy to make it compulsory for all parties with more than 49 sitting MPs to give their MPs the sole responsibility for electing their leader

attributes.action: Discounted Stamp Duty for First Time Buyers + Include Essex for HTB ISA £450k.
attributes.background: Unfair discrimination for FT Buyers in Essex. No house value is below 250k for Stamp Duty. Also Help to Buy ISA unfair threshold of £250k in Essex doesn't get buy you anything. Essex has similar house prices to London
attributes.additional_details: Average house price in Essex well above Stamp duty and help to buy threshold. This needs to be discussed.

attributes.action: Make the smoking of tobacco in a household with children under 18 an offense.
attributes.background: In England there is already a ban on smoking in a car with children under 18, however smoke can linger within rooms of a home for long periods of time, this and smoke residue that falls on food and surfaces can put children the most at risk of health problems as their lungs are not fully developed.
attributes.additional_details:
"It’s estimated that, every year, second-hand smoke kills over 12,000 people in the UK from lung cancer, heart disease, stroke and the lung disease Chronic Obstructive Pulmonary Disease (COPD)."
- Cancer Research UK

http://www.cancerresearchuk.org/about-cancer/causes-of-cancer/smoking-and-cancer/passive-smoking#qUzJibFS5IwmCGXk.99

attributes.action: New floating national bank holiday in summer linked to hottest, sunniest day
attributes.background: There exists a need for a new national bank holiday between May and August. We propose new no fixed date, merely a floating day linked to the hottest / sunniest day of the year. That way everyone could have today off in the sunshine! This serves as a positive moral boost over unguaranteed weekends
attributes.additional_details: There are precedents of floating days such as Royal events or public mourning. This should be seen as an equal floating day but with a much more positive morale boost for the nation.

attributes.action: If the average temperature of the UK reaches 30ºC, a bank holiday is  declared.
attributes.background: This year it has taken until the 19th July for summer to arrive and for the temperature to surpass 30ºC, the hard working British people deserve better than having to commute and work on such a nice day. We have some of the greatest parks in the world we should use them more.
attributes.additional_details: We already have the least amount of bank holidays in the UK compared to the rest of Europe. (Germany has 13). It is a good excuse for society to come together and enjoy what seems to be last unifying British activity of frolicking in the sun.

attributes.action: ARM must remain a majority UK owned company.
attributes.background: ARM is probably the most successful UK Tech Company. Ownership of this vital sector is disappearing into foreign hands at an alarming rate. The UK Government should hold a golden share.
attributes.additional_details: Theresa May the new Prime Minister has just said some UK vital companies may be protected. ARM is one of these. This should be debated in Parliament at the earliest opportunity.

attributes.action: Use Dog DNA to solve dog pooh problems
attributes.background: Dogs create around 1000 tons of pooh per day in the UK. Current initiatives are not effective in forcing owners to pick up their dogs pooh. As dogs now have to be microchipped, I propose that their DNA is included in the information on the microchip. This in turn can be used to trace the owners.

attributes.action: Total referendum votes per geographic area should not be made public.
attributes.background: An individuals vote in the UK is private and is only public if they choose it to be so. This should also apply too the votes of geographic areas and age groups. So this same consideration for privacy of individuals should apply also to geographic areas and age groups.
attributes.additional_details: There is no reason for this information to be made public or even recorded, except for the media to create drama and a division within the country. When a democracy makes a decision, the result should be the nations result and not multiple results specific to areas of the country, or a age group. Focusing what percentage voted what and where, serves no benefit to the nation, and only divides it. So no longer provide the public with a group to attack, when a vote does not go ones way.

attributes.action: Designated vape only areas where not permitted in doors
attributes.background: People have taken on "vaping" to give up smoking and to have a cleaner healthier lifestyle, some pubs and places of work alow vaping in doors and welcome it where as others do not, then in most cases vapours are forced to use smoking areas exposing themselves to the chemicals and toxins
attributes.additional_details: I would like to see designated vaping areas in places that have designated smoking areas where vaping is not permitted in doors. I don't think its fair that vapers are being exposed to cigarette smoke. They have taken up vaping from smoking for a healthier lifestyle and to have smokers and vapers together in one area is not ideal. I would like to see vapers have same rights as smokers but treated separately.

attributes.action: Train operators should provide more rolling stock to give all commuters a seat
attributes.background: Train operators habitually operate trains with 4 carriages at peak times causing dangerous levels of overcrowding. Many at non-peak times have up to 12 nearly empty carriages.  They justify this to get rolling stock into position. If they were to invest in enough stock this wouldn't be necessary.
attributes.additional_details: This is self evident to thousands of commuters who use the trains everyday and put up with poor customer service. Part of the franchise should enforce investment in rolling stock to fully meet peak demand.

attributes.action: A vote of no confidence in Boris Johnson as the UK's foreign secretary.
attributes.background: Boris Johnson has consistently demonstrated a lack of awareness towards Europe and the rest of the world. Why would we, citizens of the United Kingdom allow this man to represent us in Europe and the rest of the world as our foreign secretary?

attributes.action: Make it compulsory for companies to disclose their phone number on contact.
attributes.background: Make it compulsory for companies to disclose their phone number when contacting people. This will give people the chance to call bar nuisance callers directly from home and hopefully bring a stop to the constantly ringing telephone and recorded messages.

attributes.action: cap the price of household line rental to £10.00 a month.
attributes.background: over £200. per year in line rental charges by service providers, thats before any other charges are made,, it needs to be capped at £10.00.

attributes.action: Immediately raise the minimum wage by 10% to counteract the slump in the pound
attributes.background: People on minimum wage - especially those like myself aged between 18 and 21 - struggled to make ends meet as things were. With all imported products risen in price by 10% due to the slump in the pound, we need some support. We the undersigned call on the government to raise NMW by 10%.
attributes.additional_details: Due to the result of the EU referendum, the pound has dropped by more than 10% against the euro and dollar, increasing the price of all imported goods. It is forecast to drop further. This affects those on lower wages a considerable amount. As I am currently being paid £5.30 an hour, any increase in costs could make me unable to support myself. I fear that I may fall into debt and/or become a burden on the state - this is not something I would like to happen to myself or others in my position.
